title: Champions Rangers crowned in style - The Nation Newspaper
body_text:
Sports
June 24, 2024 by Our Reporter
Champions Rangers crowned in style
- Enyimba, Remo Stars grab continental tickets
- Sporting Lagos relegated
Enugu Rangers were yesterday crowned Nigeria Professional Football League (NPFL) champions in style after they beat hosts Gombe United 2-1 to finish top of the standings on 70 points from 38 matches.
Rangers will represent Nigeria in the CAF Champions League.
Kazeem Ogunleye put Rangers ahead in Jos after just three minutes.
Godwin Obaje then scored his 12th goal of the season in the seventh minute for ‘The Flying Antelopes’ to stay ahead 2-0.
Anas Hassan then pulled a goal back for already relegated Gombe United on 25 minutes.
Rangers are expected back in Enugu today on a chartered flight before they embark on a trophy parade at Okpara Square later that day.
Meanwhile, Remo Stars and Enyimba will represent Nigeria on the continent after both teams won their final games of the season today.
Remo Stars beat visiting Katsina United 2-1 to finish as runners-up on 65 points, five points adrift of champions Enugu Rangers.
They will play in the CAF Champions League along with Rangers.
Last season champions Enyimba stopped Plateau United 2-0 at home to finish third on 63 points and they will feature in the second-tier CAF Confederation Cup.
Read Also: Gov. Mbah congratulates Rangers for winning NPFL title
Meanwhile, Sporting Lagos suffered relegation after they were undone by a 1-0 defeat away to Shooting Stars in Ibadan
The Noisy Lagosians dropped to the second tier Nigeria National League (NNL) with Doma United to the who were held to a 1-1 draw by President Federation Cup finalist, Abia Warriors at the Pantami Stadium.
In a related development, Enyimba striker Chijioke Mbaoma has won the Eunisell Boot as the top scorer in the NPFL for the 2023/24 season.
He succeeds another Enyimba striker, Emeka Obioma, who was top scorer last season
Mbaoma netted his 17th goal of the season in yesterday’s final game against Plateau United in Aba while Sikiru Alimi of Remo Stars netted 15 goals
NPFL RESULTS
Gombe United 1-2 Rangers
Kano Pillars 3-2 Lobi Stars
Shooting Stars 1-0 Sporting Lagos
Doma United 1-1 Abia Warriors
Enyimba FC 2-0 Plateau United
Kwara United 4-0 Heartland
Niger Tornadoes 2-1 Sunshine Stars
Insurance 0-2 Bayelsa United
Akwa United 3-1 Rivers United
Remo Stars 2-1 Katsina United
